intro: Bupleurum aristatum f. fastigiatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or along streambanks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and herbal gardens.
